description:
runtime: detect hash map collision problems

This can only happen if the hash function we're using is getting
far more than it's fair share of collisions, but that has happened
to us repeatedly as we've expanded the allowed use cases for
hash tables (issue 1544, issue 2609, issue 2630, issue 2883, issue 3695).
Maybe this will help the next time we try something new.

messages.text:
LGTM
what are those funny marks on the end of the line?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/
Mike Burrows reviewed and okayed this CL.

*** Submitted as f99b9475b914 ***

runtime: detect hash map collision problems

This can only happen if the hash function we're using is getting
far more than it's fair share of collisions, but that has happened
to us repeatedly as we've expanded the allowed use cases for
hash tables (issue 1544, issue 2609, issue 2630, issue 2883, issue 3695).
Maybe this will help the next time we try something new.

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6306083

On Sun, Jun 24, 2012 at 7:42 PM,  <r@golang.org> wrote:
> what are those funny marks on the end of the line?

not sure, but i think it is the way people used to write comments.

subject: code review 6306083: runtime: detect hash map collision problems
